body.p:
To his excellency B Magoffin
Govenor of the commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully represent that Jasper & Benjiman Sandford wer Seperately fined at the last April term of the Boone circuit in the sum of $50 each for a violation of the law against selling spiritous liqours to minors The were guilty of but a Single offense each and that was in selling to one Hicks who has been for sevrel years trading through the county as an adut & has evey appearance of being truely alone truely one & the said Sandfords not suspitious his non age ^but believing him to be of age^ sold him the liquor They are both poor men. & under the present state of finacial pressure in the country they are wholly unable to pay the fines without a great sacrafice in vew of the facts your petioners respectfuly pray your excelency to remitt the affor said fines
I Join in the prayer of the petition

Boone Cir Ct
Respite 12 mo
B. M
$50. } Liquor to Minors
J. & B. Sandford
Issd May 17. 1861
